parameters: \pop[2]He's clearly deciding whether or not to set his plan into motion.
\pop[2]I can't even begin to imagine how much pressure is on his shoulders right now.
\pop[2]The leader of \c[10]Argus\c[0] was right. He's about to introduce chaos into order.
\pop[2]His intended outcome was good, but is that how it would play out?
\pop[2]Until he followed through, I guess he'd have no idea.
\pop[2]And that must be the terrifying part...
\pop[2]I look at my friends, and they all seem locked in fear and anticipation.
\pop[2]Especially with Klace, who looks particularly shocked.
\pop[2]Isaac lets out a deep sigh, and closes his eyes.
\pop[2]He's muttering something to himself, as if it were a mantra.
\pop[2]The culmination of his life's work is right within his reach. It's admirable.
\pop[2]Then, he opens his eyes, and looks over at all of us.
\pop[2]The hint of worry and doubt he wore on his face is soon replaced with a smirk.
\pop[2]Whatever he had said to himself, it clearly provided him with resolve.
\pop[2]He presses the button, and a second later, all the lights shut off.
\pop[2]Even the pulsing lights on the servers turn off. It's as if they're dead.
\pop[2]I'm immediately concerned for Taylor's well-being, but remember he's not here.
\pop[2]I make sure to stand still, so I don't accidentally bump into anything.
\pop[4]I removed the shackles on \c[10]The System\c[0]'s AI.
\pop[4]That doesn't sound like a good idea to me.
\pop[2]Last time there was an unshackled AI...
It'll be overwhelmed with data, and terminate itself.
With a couple homemade mods, of course.
I wanted to see what you did with the drones.
\pop[2]As if on cue, all the lights turn back on, including the TV's.
\pop[2]Much to our surprise however, nothing has happened in the town square.
\pop[2]Everyone on-screen looks confused, and is looking around at each other.
\pop[4]Heh. I didn't do anything with the drones. It was just a ploy.
Even the town square was a distraction, just like I said.
\pop[4]Hold on. It should happen in a few more seconds.
This is it, everyone. The moment of truth.
\pop[2]All of our phones go off in unison.
\pop[2]There's a notification on mine that says "Welcome to \c[10]The System\c[0], Delta".
\pop[2]It's the same notification I got when I signed up as a teenager.
\pop[2]But this time, there's some sort of file attached to the notification.
\pop[4]It's the blueprint I used to get you into \c[10]The System\c[0].
\pop[2]He tilts his head toward the TV.
\pop[2]Everybody in the town square is looking down at their phones.
\pop[2]Isaac smirks. It's that semi-evil smirk again.
\pop[4]Anybody with a phone can now help out a \c[23]zero\c[0]. Just like I did.
And because of their monopoly, that's, well...
\pop[2]Isaac was operating on a global scale this entire time?
\pop[4]I assume most of you have a spare phone or two?
\pop[2]Isaac starts typing at the computer again, like he's doing one last thing.
\pop[4]Anyone in the same situation can now give their spare phone to a \c[23]zero\c[0].
In fact, there's probably more spare phones lying around than we'd ever need.
\pop[2]Turn everybody against \c[10]Argus\c[0]. Make them favor the \c[23]zeros\c[0]...
\pop[2]Then, give \c[14]all\c[0] of them the power to change the world.
\pop[2]Looking back at the TV, the leader of \c[10]Argus\c[0] is being evacuated.
\pop[2]I guess the town square really \c[14]was\c[0] the least of their problems.
\pop[2]There's a bit of anger on their face before the camera cuts.
\pop[2]Isaac stops typing, and finally leaves the computer behind.
\pop[4]Nah. I just have too much time on my hands.
\pop[4]But now, \c[10]Argus\c[0] isn't the only entry point into \c[10]The System\c[0].
I'm gonna turn \c[23]Cipher\c[0] into the first \c[14]true\c[0] competitor.
\i[3]"You think the world powers would allow that...?"
\i[3]"You think the world powers would allow that...?"
\pop[4]I don't think they have a choice.
\pop[4]Once you introduce chaos into order, all you can do is find order again.
And the playing field is \c[14]exactly\c[0] where I want it to be.
\pop[3]You still should've told us you were \c[23]Hermes\c[0], though...
\pop[2]He scoffs, and we all look at one another.
\pop[2]As if to rob us of our victory, however, Klace looks terrified.
\pop[2]He has his back pressed against the servers, and is almost crying.
\pop[2]He cuts himself off, and immediately runs toward Isaac.
\pop[2]Placing his hands on Isaac's shoulders, he shakes him as he speaks.
\pop[4]I know, I was planning on it.
We still have about six minutes-
We need to start driving, and never come back!
\pop[3]I need you to listen to me for once, Isaac!
We need to go. Right! Now!
\pop[2]He runs toward the elevator, and presses the button on it.
\pop[2]We were all leaving anyway, so we really have no choice.
\pop[2]But I've never seen him act this way before.
\pop[2]All of a sudden I'm reminded of his diary.
\pop[2]The elevator opens, and we all gather up inside.
\pop[2]Isaac places his hands on Klace's shoulders, and looks him in the eye.
I'll get in the car, and drive, alright?
\pop[2]Klace nods, while trembling in fear at the same time.
\pop[2]As the elevator begins its ascent, that fear transfers to all of us.
\pop[2]I'm starting to piece it together in my mind, but \c[14]one\c[0] fact is clear.
\pop[2]This might not end as well as we thought. At least, for us...
